title: Integrated Instructional Approach for Developing Mental Arithmetic Skills: Realistic and Progressive Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental arithmetic computation skills and understanding of number systems
context.additional_context: Educational program aimed at enhancing learners' cognitive flexibility and diversifying problem-solving strategies, developing mental arithmetic skills through gradual integration of real-world contexts and procedural learning

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more flexible mental arithmetic strategies using the empty number line model to real-world contextual problems
Learners systematically acquire skills from basic operational procedures to complex problem-solving through progressive learning stages, achieving over 90% accuracy
Learners enhance metacognitive abilities by analyzing their problem-solving processes and selecting optimal strategies through formative assessment tasks
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
